titles.title: Family Health Tax Cut Act
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow individuals a credit against income tax for medical expenses for dependents.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 6/29/2000--Introduced. Family Health Tax Cut Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow individuals a tax credit ($500 or $3,000 per dependent, depending upon the medical care) for dependents' unreimbursed medical care expenses. Coordinates such credit with the medical deduction and the employment- related dependent care credit to avoid double benefits.
